remarks.tbcases:
L'intérpretation du point 2.11 prête confusion pour certains. En effet, ces derniers prennent comme dénominateur tous les patients tuberculeux enregistrés au cours de la période, d'autres prennent la somme de 2.1 & 2.3, d'autres encore excluent les extrapulmonaires,car non testés au Xpert MTB/RIF. 
Bref, une assistance technique de l'OMS nous serait d'une importance capitale.

remarks.hiv.patients:

Le rapport 2021 du Programme TB fait état de 249 PVVIH connues,qui ont développé la tuberculose et 138 Tuberculeux testés VIH positifs grâce au dépistage VIH initié par le prestataire.

La información de esta sección solo corresponde a casos de TB sensible. 

Las pruebas de diagnóstico rápido realizadas corresponden a pruebas Xpert MTB/RIF efectuadas en personas privadas de la libertad de la Zona 8 por ser la zona geográfica con más alta carga de la enfermedad
remarks.mdr.patients:
Los casos reportados en esta pagina no estan incluidos en los numerales 2.1 al 2.4, debido a las fuentes de información que no permiten recolectar todos los datos. 

Se inició tratamientos acortados orales con bedaquilina y BpAL a partir de septiembre del 2021; las pruebas para resistencia a quinolonas se realizaron mediante métodos convencionales implementando pruebas MTB/XDR a partir de febrero 2022,la incorporación de casos diagnosticados en el 2021 al 2022.
remarks.dr.surveillance:
En el numeral 2.32 que se reporta 2060 pruebas de resistencia a R y H corresponde al total de pruebas de todos los afectados nuevos y antes tratados, el sistema informativo no permite desglosar de acuerdo al requerimiento.

En el numeral 2.28 y 2.29 se reporta el total de pruebas, ya que el sistema de información no nos permite desglosar entre nuevos y antes tratados.

Ecuador no realiza pruebas de sensibilidad a bedaquilina y/o linezolid.

hiv.tpt.eligible.start.remarks:
currently on ART  TPT data is from parallel report  only for few regions (6).

TPT data for currently / previously enrolled is not reported through the national HMIS /DHIS2 system. To fill the gap, regions collect and aggregate  HF level data for TPT backlog clearance. Such data is monitored at the facility level and reported parallelly for program monitoring purposes and it is reported only from few(6) regions. Therefore, we have decided to report the data ( TPT for currently enrolled ) using the data in hand. 

Recommendation - we can remove the TPT data for currently enrolled if it is not well justified, mainly for those who are previously enrolled.
hiv.tpt.completed.remarks:
No age category data for 
TPT completion is higher than initiation; this  could be due to :
-Delayed TPT initiation for previously enrolled ART clients 
-Data quality issues in TB/HIV program
The same to 7.9, TPT completion is not reported through  DHIS2. The figure reported for this FY(2021) was collected parallelly from few regions. Though the period considers those who started TPT prior to the reporting period, the report is incomplete. This might be improved for future reporting periods as the indicators are being included under the revised list of indicators.

hiv.tbrx.art.remarks:
METODOLOGÍA:
Para la construcción del numerador del indicador se utilizó la base de datos de Coinfección VIH-TB con datos nominales de las 16 Unidades de Atención Integral del MSPAS. En la base se registran todos los pacientes con Tuberculosis que tiene identificados el Programa de Tuberculosis, se utiliza la variable de "VIH" para seleccionar a aquellos pacientes con la opción "R" que significa que son positivos confirmado de VIH. Para identificar si reciben terapia combinada, se selección la opción "Si" de la variable de "TARV". 

No hay datos para poder desagregar el indicador por ciudad, esto debido a que los instrumentos no recolectan información de la ciudad de residencia de las personas actualmente.

Se utiliza el dato consensuado junto el Programa de Tuberculosis.
hiv.tbdetect.hiv.reg.new2.remarks:
METODOLOGÍA:
Para la construcción del numerador del indicador se utilizó la base de datos de Coinfección VIH-TB con datos nominales de las 16 Unidades de Atención Integral del MSPAS. En la base se registran todos los pacientes con Tuberculosis que tiene identificados el Programa de Tuberculosis, se utiliza la variable de "VIH" para seleccionar a aquellos pacientes con la opción "R" que significa que son positivos confirmado de VIH. Para identificar si reciben tratamiento antirretroviral, se selección la opción "Si" de la variable de "TARV". Finalmente para identificar que son nuevos, se selecciona de la variable de "Fecha de VIH" el año 2021. 

Para la construcción del denominador se utilizó el número de personas consolidado de la sumatoria de lo reportado en el Anexo D "Consolidado mensual de personas recibiendo terapia antirretroviral" del cuadro de "IV. PACIENTES CON VIH DE NUEVO INGRESO A LA UAI EN TAR EN EL MES DEL REPORTE" y del Anexo F del cuadro de "IX. PACIENTE
hiv.tpt.eligible.start.remarks:
METODOLOGÍA (Recién matriculados en la atención del VIH):
Para la construcción del numerador del indicador de personas recién inscritas en servicios de VIH con TAR que iniciaron tratamiento para la infección por tuberculosis latente; se utilizo el número consolidado de personas reportadas en el Anexo E "Consolidado Mensual Infecciones oportunistas en personas con VIH" del cuadro de "VIII. PACIENTES VIH EN TAR QUE INICIAN TERAPIA PREVENTIVA DE LA TUBERCULOSIS (TPT) - (COHORTE NUEVOS)" de las 16 Unidades de Atención Integral del MSPAS. Para las instituciones que no reportan en los anexos (IGSS; Sanidad Militar y Hospicio San José); se solicitó la información en matrices consolidadas, sin embargo, no reportaron datos para este indicador. 

Para la construcción del denominador se utilizó el número de personas consolidado de la sumatoria de lo reportado en el Anexo D "Consolidado mensual de personas recibiendo terapia antirretroviral" del cuadro de "IV. PACIENTES CON VIH D
hiv.tpt.completed.remarks:
METODOLOGÍA:
Para la construcción del numerador del indicador se utilizó el número consolidado de personas reportadas en el Anexo E "Consolidado Mensual Infecciones oportunistas en personas con VIH" del cuadro de "IX. PACIENTES VIH EN TAR QUE COMPLETARON UN CICLO DE TPT EN EL MES DE REPORTE - (COHORTE TOTAL)" y del cuadro de "X. PACIENTES VIH EN TAR QUE COMPLETARON UN CICLO DE TPT EN EL MES DE REPORTE - (COHORTE NUEVOS)" de las 16 Unidades de Atención Integral del MSPAS. Para las instituciones que no reportan en los anexos (IGSS; Sanidad Militar y Hospicio San José); se solicitó la información en matrices consolidadas, sin embargo, no reportaron datos para este indicador. 

Para la construcción del denominador se utilizó el dato de personas con VIH en TAR que comenzaron TPT el año pasado (2020).

No hay datos para poder desagregar el indicador por ciudad, esto debido a que los instrumentos no recolectan información de la ciudad de residencia de las personas actualment

remarks.mdr.patients: Niue Department of Health (DoH) relies heavily on UNDP TB & HIV regional pharmacy and lab consumable supplies. We haven't received any since May 2021, hence we have no stock, no cases, and no testing. Our last data was in 2019-2020 of registered and listed LTBI for follow up. Niue DoH will need these supplies as soon as possible, given international border restrictions on Covid-19. Thank you.

hiv.tbrx.art.remarks:
Based on the estimates of HIV-positive incident TB cases for 2014 (WHO TB Data) which is 12 cases for Serbia (<10 cases - 20 cases) or Inc rate of 0.12 per 100.000 population and in line with estimated HIV sero prevalence among hospitalized TB patients which was 0.3% (representative cross-sectional survey conducted in 2011 by IPH of Serbia),  notified TB cases and incident HIV+ TB cases in previous period the best estimates of HIV+ incident TB cases provided by experts is less than 10 for 2021.  

So, the estimated coverage of HIV infected people  with diagnosed TB who were co-manged of TB and HIV infection is more than 90%.

hiv.tbrx.art.remarks:
This data is from NCID HIV Programme Database which only accounts for HIV diagnosed patients of age 15 and above presenting at the National Centre for Infectious Diseases (NCID) and Tan Tock Seng Hospital (TTSH) Infectious Diseases clinics, which covers about 60-70% of HIV cases in Singapore. 
The data does not cover patients seen at other healthcare institutions. 

RECRUITMENT/SCREENING CRITERIA
1. Only patients who have clinic visit to NCID/TTSH Infectious Diseases starting from 2006 onwards; 
2. HIV-positive patients 
3. At least one time outpatient clinic visit
*Note: Added the list of new foreigners cases starting from January 2017 onwards 

EXCLUSION CRITERIA 
- Only inpatient cases 
- GRT/Eye referral patients from other hospitals
- Foreigners whose first clinic visit earlier than 2017
The data is provided by NCID and TTSH Infectious Diseases only, which covers about 60-70% of HIV cases in Singapore. 

The data does not cover patients seen at other healthcare ins

remarks.mdr.patients: NO MDR-TB diagnosed during the reporting period.
remarks.hiv.patients: 1 TB/HIV co-infection case diagnosed during the reporting period have completed DOTS and is currently on ART and cared for by the Treatment Core Team from the Ministry.

National HIV surveillance program data reflects the detected HIV/TB cases at the time of first HIV diagnosis. National HIV surveillance does not include follow up information, it means that there is no data for the patients who have been diagnosed with HIV before 2021 and have been diagnosed with TB in 2021. Therefore national HIV surveillance data is less than the number we have given in 2.46. Our data presented here shows all cases of TB/HIV co-infection in 2021 TB patient cohort.
remarks.tbdeaths: Routinely the vital registration system (The Turkish Statistical Institute's)releases it's data in June every year. The institute postponed the announcement this year.

remarks.tbcases: Compilation of data and review was also completed by Dr. Sateesh Sakhamuri
the number of TB cases reported among foreign-born individuals represents only the last two quarters of 2021 after revision of the DHIS2-ETL surveillance system
remarks.mdr.patients: The RR/MDR-TB detection increased  by 6% compared to 2020. Despite the increase detection is below the 2021 target this has been contributed to the limited access to DST among the TB patients notified.
remarks.dr.surveillance: In 2022 report there is an increase of 42% among bacteriological confirmed pulmonary cases who accessed DST testing at least for Rifampicin this has been contributed by increase in number of Genexpert machines and implementation of integrated sample referral system.

remarks.mdr.patients: 2.14 and 2.15, 2.20 - numbers based on the new definition of resistance to fluoroquinolones (LEVO and MOXI only)? We know that patients have been started on Bedaquiline for the treatment of MDR TB, pre-XDR TB, and XDR TB but do not have a full accounting of the number of patients.
remarks.dr.surveillance:
2.36 and 2.37 - preXDR is defined as resistance to any fluoroquinolone or resistance to a second-line injectable (amikacin, kanamycin or capreomycin) because we are unable to collect this information under the new WHO definition.  XDR is captured under resistance to both classes identified above for preXDR or for bedaquiline or linezolid resistance if entered in our surveillance data set.
2.38 - 2.40 - unknown testing to bedaquiline and linezolid at this time.
remarks.hiv.patients: Patients with previous episodes of TB are excluded from the totals.

La información al Programa de VIH sobre TB es proporcionada por el Programa Nacional de Tuberculosis. El dato al Programa de VIH fue previo, posteriormente se revisaron los datos y por esto el número definitivo fue modificado.

remarks.hiv.patients: 2.46.- Para el momento de aportar los datos al Informe GAM, no se disponía del total de la informacion referente a los casos de TB-VIH con TARV, se realizo la nota en el informe GAM y se comunico el cambio a los Coordinadores del Programa de VIH a nivel nacional en el mes de mayo. Lo mismo ocurrio con la informacion de las personas que viven con VIH e inician tratamiento Preventivo para TB (7.9), el dato que aparece en el informe (85), se ha mantenido.

remarks.tbcases:

remarks.tbcases: 2.6: South Africa does not disaggregate information according to nationality and race.
hiv.tbrx.art.remarks:
Data sourced from the TB/HIV patient data base is as complete and accurate as information documented in the patient record/clinical record by clinicians in health facilities.  It is also dependent on the timeous capture of patient information from the patient record into the patient data base by administrative clerks/data capturers in health facilities, and the movement/flow of that information to the next level of health.
For patients on both ART and TB treatment, TB information is documented in the TB Blue Card while HIV/ART information is documented in the ART Clinical Stationery.  When a (co-infected) patient completes TB treatment, the TB Blue Card is no longer utilised to document clinical information.  The clinician continues documenting HIV/ART information in the ART Clinical Stationery.  The ART stationery does not require clinicians to document a TB treatment stop date (only requires a "year") after TB treatment is complete.
hiv.tbdetect.hiv.reg.new2.remarks: Data sourced from the TB/HIV patient data base is as complete and accurate as information documented in the patient record/clinical record by clinicians in health facilities.  It is also dependent on the timeous capture of patient information from the patient record into the patient data base by administrative clerks/data capturers in health facilities, and the movement/flow of that information to the next level of health.
hiv.tpt.eligible.start.remarks:
Data sourced from the TB/HIV patient data base is as complete and accurate as information documented in the patient record/clinical record by clinicians in health facilities.  It is also dependent on the timeous capture of patient information from the patient record into the patient data base by administrative clerks/data capturers in health facilities, and the movement/flow of that information to the next level of health.
Yes.  To adequately report this information in the patient data base, clinicians MUST document a TPT start date in the ART Clinical Stationery.
hiv.tpt.completed.remarks:
Data sourced from the TB/HIV patient data base is as complete and accurate as information documented in the patient record/clinical record by clinicians in health facilities.  It is also dependent on the timeous capture of patient information from the patient record into the patient data base by administrative clerks/data capturers in health facilities, and the movement/flow of that information to the next level of health.
The ART Clinical Stationery does not require clinicians to document a TPT regimen or a "stop date".  This can be documented in the "Clinical Notes" section (free text).

remarks.tbcases: The National TB reporting tools that the country is using do not disaggregate cases of TB by nationality.
remarks.dr.surveillance: Rifampicin and isoniazid testing is not disaggregated by New and Relapse.
hiv.tbdetect.hiv.reg.new2.remarks: The country does not currently track PLHIV with active TB among those that are newly enrolled in HIV treatment, but rather reports TB patients testing positive to HIV started on ART. As such, the data (numerator) provided in the report is from the cases that were notified in 2021, while the denominator is from the HIV program (newly enrolled in HIV care). This is used as a proxy, as the country does not currently track active TB in the HIV population.
hiv.tpt.eligible.start.remarks:
Data on TPT only covers 0-14 years and 15+ years. No finer disaggregation i.e <5 years, 5-15 years. Hence, the gaps noted.
The data covers clients who have not received TPT in the past three years.

remarks.tbcases: Among the cases reported in questions 2.1 – 2.4, total number of TB cases reported among foreign-born individuals (or among non-citizens if that is the criterion used in your country) . This criteria is not used in our country.
remarks.dr.surveillance: Aggregate data for rifampicin resistance testing not available disaggregated by history of TB treatment.
remarks.hiv.patients: The Ministry is currently working on the EHR system in order to have a case-based surveillance system. Testing for HIV is done as part of basic minimum of care at all entry points in the healthcare facilities. ART among TB/HIV co-infected patients is a basic standard of care. Hence the high coverage of testing and ART initiation.
remarks.nonroutine.hiv: Was there non-routine surveillance of HIV prevalence in TB patients using nationwide surveys and/or sentinel sites in 2021? The  survey was not conducted
